gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: Gonad Index (GI) from the MuLTI-2 project

gmd:organisationName.gmx:Anchor: Downeast Institute for Applied Marine Research and Education

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: MuLTI-2 gonad index data Dataset Description: <p>Data quantifying temporal patterns in blue mussel (<em>Mytilus edulis</em>) gonad index in large mussel beds in coastal eastern Maine.</p><p>Collections occured in coastal waters of eastern Maine, from Frenchman Bay to the Canadian border.</p><p><strong>Related datasets:</strong></p><ul><li><a href="http://www.bco-dmo.org/dataset/658755" style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border: 0px; font-style: inherit; font-variant: inherit; font-weight: inherit; font-stretch: inherit; font-size: inherit; line-height: inherit; font-family: inherit; vertical-align: baseline; text-decoration: none; color: rgb(0, 102, 153);">Gonad Index Station List</a></li><li><a href="http://www.bco-dmo.org/dataset/658758" style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border: 0px; font-style: inherit; font-variant: inherit; font-weight: inherit; font-stretch: inherit; font-size: inherit; line-height: inherit; font-family: inherit; vertical-align: baseline; text-decoration: none; color: rgb(0, 102, 153);">Gonad Index Stations Sampled</a></li></ul><table class="cols-2 views-table" style="border-collapse:collapse; border-spacing:0px; border:1px solid rgb(102, 102, 102); color:rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family:helvetica,arial,sans-serif; font-size:0.95em; font-stretch:inherit; font-variant-numeric:inherit; line-height:inherit; margin:0px; padding:1em 0px 0px; vertical-align:baseline; width:704.545px"></table> Acquisition Description: <p>15-25 individual blue mussels (<em>Mytilus edulis</em>) were randomly sampled at each of the major mussel beds (stations) along the eastern Maine coast from Frenchman Bay to the Canadian border. Sampling reflected the existing size frequency distribution of mussels within each bed, but was truncated at a minimum shell length of 25 mm to ensure mussels were of reproductive size. For each individual mussel, sample processing consisted of measuring the shell length (0.1 mm resolution), and then dissecting out the gonad and somatic soft tissue separately. Gonad and somatic soft tissues were weighed separately to 0.01 g resolution.</p>

gmd:credit.gmx:Anchor: Funding provided by NSF Division of Ocean Sciences (NSF OCE) Award Number: OCE-1333755 Award URL: http://nsf.gov/awardsearch/showAward?AWD_ID=1333755

gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: An integrated theoretical and empirical approach to across-shelf mixing and connectivity of mussel populations

gmd:name.gmx:Anchor: An integrated theoretical and empirical approach to across-shelf mixing and connectivity of mussel populations

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Acronym "MuLTI-2" (Mussel Larval Transport Initiative-2)Extracted from the NSF award abstract:Existing larval transport models focus mainly on along-shelf transport and have done little to explicitly incorporate the effects of cross-shelf mixing and transport processes. Yet cross-shelf transits (both outgoing and incoming legs) are critical components of the dispersal paths of coastal invertebrates. This project will explore the role of cross-shelf mixing in the connectivity of blue mussel populations in eastern Maine. Previous work has shown that the Eastern Maine Coastal Current (EMCC) begins to diverge from shore southwest of the Grand Manan Channel and creates a gradient in cross-shelf mixing and larval transport, with cross-shelf mixing being more common on the northeastern end, episodic in the transitional middle area, and then becoming rare in the southwestern half of the region of the Gulf of Maine. As a result, the investigators predict that northeastern populations of mussels are seeded mostly from up-stream sources, while a significant component of self-seeding (local retention) exists in southwestern populations. Larvae settling in the intervening bays are expected to be derived from a mixture of local and up-stream sources. Using a combined empirical and theoretical approach hydrographic, current profile, and larval vertical migration data will be collected and used to develop and validate a high-resolution coastal circulation model coupled to a model of larval behavior. The investigators will model simulations in different years using the empirical data from mussel reproductive output and spawning times. Connectivity predicted from this model will be then tested against independent empirical estimates of connectivity based on trace element fingerprinting for larvae which can be connected to specific natal habitats. Regions of agreement and discrepancy in the model will be identified to guide additional data collection and model refinement. This iterative process will ensure an understanding of both larval transport patterns and processes, and provide estimates of inter-annual variability in connectivity for blue mussel populations in the Gulf of Maine.
Coastal eastern Maine, from Frenchman Bay to the Canadian border

gmd:otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/658882.rdf Name: sampling_event Units: unitless Description: Identifier of sampling event http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/658883.rdf Name: station_code Units: unitless Description: Station code http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/658884.rdf Name: sample_date Units: unitless Description: Date sample was taken http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/658885.rdf Name: year Units: unitless Description: Year of sample http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/658886.rdf Name: lat Units: decimal degrees Description: Latitude http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/658887.rdf Name: lon Units: decimal degrees Description: Longitude; west is negative http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/658888.rdf Name: shell_length Units: unitless Description: Shell length measurement (0.1 mm resolution) http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/658889.rdf Name: gonad_weight Units: grams Description: Gonad soft tissue weight http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/658890.rdf Name: somatic_weight Units: grams Description: Somatic soft tissue weight http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/658891.rdf Name: GI Units: dimensionless Description: Gonad index; Proportion of soft tissue weight attributable to gonad soft tissue: GI = gonad_weight/(somatic_weight + gonad_weight)

gmd:otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P01/current/ADATAA01/ Name: Date (UT as yyyymmdd) Description: Unavailable http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P01/current/YEARXXXX/ Name: Year since birth of Christ Description: The number of Gregorian calendar years that have elapsed since the birth of Christ. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P09/current/LATX/ Name: LATITUDE Description: The angular distance north or south from the equator, measured along the meridian of the point of interest. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P09/current/LONX/ Name: LONGITUDE Description: The angular distance east or west east or west of Greenwich to the point of interest.

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Identifier of sampling event; General Description: event or operation number; often derived from date/time (MMDDHHmm) of sampling and when combined with year (YYYY) is a unique sampling identifier/data processing key. Date/time is not necessarily in GMT.
PI-supplied Description: Station code; General Description: consecutive station number

PI-supplied Description: Date sample was taken; General Description: date; generally reported in GMT as YYYYMMDD (year; month; day); also as MMDD (month; day); EqPac dates are local Hawaii time NERC Description: Unavailable
PI-supplied Description: Year of sample; General Description: year, reported as YYYY, e.g. 1995 NERC Description: The number of Gregorian calendar years that have elapsed since the birth of Christ.

PI-supplied Description: Latitude; General Description: latitude, in decimal degrees, North is positive, negative denotes South; Reported in some datasets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance north or south from the equator, measured along the meridian of the point of interest.

PI-supplied Description: Longitude; west is negative; General Description: longitude, in decimal degrees, East is positive, negative denotes West; Reported in some datsets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance east or west east or west of Greenwich to the point of interest.
PI-supplied Description: Shell length measurement (0.1 mm resolution); General Description: Length of specimen. Often in millimeters or centimeters. See dataset for units.
PI-supplied Description: Gonad soft tissue weight; General Description: weight, various units
PI-supplied Description: Somatic soft tissue weight; General Description: weight, various units

PI-supplied Description: Gonad index; Proportion of soft tissue weight attributable to gonad soft tissue: GI = gonad_weight/(somatic_weight + gonad_weight); General Description: association with a community-wide standard parameter is not yet defined

gmd:organisationName.gmx:Anchor: Biological and Chemical Oceanography Data Management Office (BCO-DMO)

gmd:contactInstructions.gco:CharacterString: For questions regarding this resource, please contact BCO-DMO via the email address provided.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: <p>15-25 individual blue mussels (<em>Mytilus edulis</em>) were randomly sampled at each of the major mussel beds (stations) along the eastern Maine coast from Frenchman Bay to the Canadian border. Sampling reflected the existing size frequency distribution of mussels within each bed, but was truncated at a minimum shell length of 25 mm to ensure mussels were of reproductive size. For each individual mussel, sample processing consisted of measuring the shell length (0.1 mm resolution), and then dissecting out the gonad and somatic soft tissue separately. Gonad and somatic soft tissues were weighed separately to 0.01 g resolution.</p>
<p>The gonad index of each individual mussel was calculated from the two measured weights (Gonad Soft Tissue Weight,&nbsp;Somatic Soft Tissue Weight).</p>
